content.raw: This is pulled from Steve's comment for warning fix.
content.html: This is pulled from Steve's comment for warning fix.

I added some pragmas in ed04463 (part of the old pull request branch) to prevent some compilation warnings related to bullet headers, but there is a stubborn warning that it not obeying the pragmas:

In file included from /usr/include/bullet_2.82/bullet/LinearMath/btQuickprof.h:22:0,
                 from /usr/include/bullet_2.82/bullet/LinearMath/btMatrixX.h:20,
                 from /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/gazebo/deps/opende/src/step_bullet_pgs_wrapper.cpp:37:
/usr/include/bullet_2.82/bullet/LinearMath/btScalar.h:337:13: warning: 'btInfinityMask' defined but not used [-Wunused-variable]
  static  int btInfinityMask = 0x7F800000;
             ^

Note that step_bullet_pgs_wrapper.cpp:37 is inside the pragma push/pop block. Is this a gcc bug?

content.raw:
Is it possible that we didn't add the `pragma` before the bullet function `btScalar.h` ?   
We stop warning for the header `LinearMath/btAlignedObjectArray.h` [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/1aa11f1bdf0b2607d7abf1c61517676854b7f3d4/deps/opende/src/step_bullet_lemke_wrapper.cpp#step_bullet_lemke_wrapper.cpp-38),   
which calls `btScalar.h`.   
It could probably be wrong, not sure whether the `pragma` could be applied recursively to the other headers called inside
content.html:
Is it possible that we didn't add the pragma before the bullet function btScalar.h ?
We stop warning for the header LinearMath/btAlignedObjectArray.h here,
which calls btScalar.h.
It could probably be wrong, not sure whether the pragma could be applied recursively to the other headers called inside

content.raw:
It looks like homebrew has a [bunch of warnings too](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/422/warnings7Result/new/).

Let's create separate header files for the bullet includes: `step_bullet_lemke_wrapper_inc.h` and `step_bullet_pgs_wrapper_inc.h`. These should look like [bullet_inc.h](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/8c5ba03fc9bf29de8d472a5dc99e3ba645b4dfda/gazebo/physics/bullet/bullet_inc.h), with a `#pragma GCC system_header` and the relevant bullet includes for each cpp file.
content.html:
It looks like homebrew has a bunch of warnings too.

Let's create separate header files for the bullet includes: step_bullet_lemke_wrapper_inc.h and step_bullet_pgs_wrapper_inc.h. These should look like bullet_inc.h, with a #pragma GCC system_header and the relevant bullet includes for each cpp file.

content.raw: The `WorldStepSolvers/PhysicsTest.DropTest/2` test (with `BULLET_LEMKE`) is [still failing](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/503/testReport/%28root%29/WorldStepSolvers_PhysicsTest/DropTest_2/).
content.html: The WorldStepSolvers/PhysicsTest.DropTest/2 test (with BULLET_LEMKE) is still failing.

content.raw:
Here is my test result: 
```
#!c++

[       OK ] WorldStepSolvers/PhysicsTest.DropTest/3 (29891 ms)
[----------] 4 tests from WorldStepSolvers/PhysicsTest (44536 ms total)

[----------] Global test environment tear-down
[==========] 4 tests from 1 test case ran. (44536 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 4 tests.
```


Based on this: 

```
#!c++
➜  gazebo  ./build_isolated/gazebo/devel/test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_solver --gtest_list_tests
WorldStepSolvers/PhysicsTest.
  DropTest/0  # GetParam() = "ODE_DANTZIG"
  DropTest/1  # GetParam() = "DART_PGS"
  DropTest/2  # GetParam() = "BULLET_PGS"
  DropTest/3  # GetParam() = "BULLET_LEMKE"

```

It seems DropTest/2 is `PGS`, not `Lemke`. And it seems I cannot reproduce [this failure](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/503/testReport/%28root%29/WorldStepSolvers_PhysicsTest/DropTest_2/) on my Mac laptop.
content.html:
Here is my test result: 

[       OK ] WorldStepSolvers/PhysicsTest.DropTest/3 (29891 ms)
[----------] 4 tests from WorldStepSolvers/PhysicsTest (44536 ms total)

[----------] Global test environment tear-down
[==========] 4 tests from 1 test case ran. (44536 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 4 tests.

Based on this: 

➜  gazebo  ./build_isolated/gazebo/devel/test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_solver --gtest_list_tests
WorldStepSolvers/PhysicsTest.
  DropTest/0  # GetParam() = "ODE_DANTZIG"
  DropTest/1  # GetParam() = "DART_PGS"
  DropTest/2  # GetParam() = "BULLET_PGS"
  DropTest/3  # GetParam() = "BULLET_LEMKE"

It seems DropTest/2 is PGS, not Lemke. And it seems I cannot reproduce this failure on my Mac laptop.
